title: E field - halfway between 2Q and -Q vs Q and -Q

content.question: Two point charges, one with a charge of <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> and one with a charge of <math alttext="negative Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>, are separated by a distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math>. The electric field at the midpoint between the point charges has a magnitude <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math>. What is the magnitude of the electric field at the midpoint if the positive charge is doubled to <math alttext="positive 2 Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math>?
